result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey F. Forrett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:34 am 
INCLUDES 15CF969, 15CF1025, 15CF1041, AND 15CF1044. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Tina Abernethy-Mays.  

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 15CF969 AND 15CF1025. 
State notes waiver of prelim needs to be completed in 15CF969 and 15CF1025. 
COURT advises plea colloquy will address all questions related to waiver of prelim and proceeds with plea colloquy. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Informations filed. 

PLEA HEARING IN 15CF969, 15CF1025, 15CF1041, AND 15CF1044. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF969: Ct. 1 (Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF1041: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 2 (DC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF1044: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF969: Ct. 2 (DC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF1025: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 73 days jail credit if revoked. 
COURT authorizes transfer of probation to Rock County. 

Adj: 10:50 am

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:17 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF696, 15CF1025, 15CF1041, AND 15CF1044. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person with Atty Tina Abernety-Mays. 
State requests bond forfeiture be vacated. 
COURT vacates bond forfeiture hearing. 
CC set for 12/2/2015 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA. 
Bond continues. 
Adj: 2:18 pm

Case Called: 11:20 am
Includes 15CF1041 and 15CF1044.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in custody and with Atty Tina Abernathy-Mays.
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea:  NOT GUILTY.
Dates set: Dates to be set with Branch 3
Bond:  Continued

C: Br. 3

Adj: 11:22 am
Shall not consume alcohol.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 within 1 business day of release with DAY REPORTING.
